mcleod4568","2016-04-04T23:06:24.43Z","The first Lego set that I have actually played with!","
The box is the same quality you would expect from the other ideas sets - nice and sturdy sealed with tape on flaps so you do not have to destroy the box to open it.

column2: on parts as my MOC ability is sorely lacking in ability but there are lots of flat tiles and baseplates. Also a big range of technic pieces as well.

column1: The build was the most fun I have had in building a Lego set for a long long time. I have never built anything with technic pieces before (that was meant to move around) and so I was fascinated to see and figure out how the pieces came together to create the mechanism that lets the Maze work.

Looks fantastic. You get bricks to build to different mazes in the set, but you can only build one at a time as both mazes use some of the same bricks. I chose to go with the medieval maze and I ordered the extra parts I need to make the other maze - so I can just swap them out whenever I want rather than waste time rebuilding the mazes over and over and over and over again.

This set has the most playability I have ever seen in a Lego set - in particular for adults I think. We all had little games like these come in our Stockings every year but now you have the added novelty of being able to design your own and it being made out of Lego of course. Mastering the controls can be a bit tricky but once you have that done the fun is timing yourself and seeing how fast you can get through each time with being caught in a trap. And then doing the maze in reverse and repeating the whole process again.
I cannot stress how awesome this set is. Go and buy it now!
